newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo stock rally ends, players await 'tankan'.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo stock rally ends, players await 'tankan'.

text.p: The Tokyo stock market's rally ended on Friday after gains over the past four days.
The key Nikkei index got off to a strong start due to the German Bundesbank's repo rate cut, but profit-taking later took hold, erasing gains.

Participants are expected to be sidelined until the Bank of Japan's survey of corporate sentiment next week, brokers said. The Nikkei 225 average closed down 134.44 points or 0.63 percent at 21,228.80. "Even though the market had advanced for four days, it still lacked a clear direction," said Chisato Takahashi, fund manager at Credit Suisse Investment Advisory.
